utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Champagne, champagne.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. No bendy straw, some party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, a toast. Thank you all for your support while we worked on our Air Force project. And please know that we could not have done it without you, so cheers.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, it’s nice of you to acknowledge us, but this is your accomplishment.

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To success without Raj.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So what happens next?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Phase two, we test it, perfect it, and hope to live long enough to see the movie based on our lives starring more attractive versions of us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll definitely live long enough. Vitamin C.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: First thing tomorrow morning, we’re back at it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Without me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hope his character doesn’t make it into the movie, he’s kind of a bummer.

utterance.speaker: Computer Voice
utterance.content: Leonard Hofstadter. Access granted.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm. I don’t care if this thing is burning out my retinas, it makes me feel special. Now, before we field test, I think we…

utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where is everything?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who else has access to this room?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a secure lab in a classified facility, only the U.S. government and us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is disconcerting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But the movie did just get good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sir, I, I, I’m sorry but I just don’t get it. You came into our lab in the middle of the night and took our prototype and all of our research and didn’t even tell us?

utterance.speaker: Col. Williams
utterance.content: Sounds like you get it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where did you move it?

utterance.speaker: Col. Williams
utterance.content: I can’t tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you implementing phase two?

utterance.speaker: Col. Williams
utterance.content: I can’t tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, so you’re just going to take all the work we’ve done for the last year and toss us aside?

utterance.speaker: Col
utterance.content: Williams: That one I can tell you, yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is all very upsetting.

utterance.speaker: Col. Williams
utterance.content: I’m sorry to hear that. As you know, the primary focus of the United States military is people’s feelings.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If that’s sarcasm, please save it for our enemies.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I may be moving out soon. I think I found a place to live.

utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry to hear that.

utterance.content: Um, well, I, yeah, you got me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where are you moving?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And when? But also where?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bert has a room for rent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, no, it’s, uh, pretty private, actually, it’s over his garage. So the only time I’ll see him is when he pulls his car in, does his laundry or practices drums in my dining room.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, good for you. I actually have a little news myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, we’re just gonna circle back to when he’s moving out? Okay, that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was, uh, asked to be a visiting researcher at Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, that’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thanks, but the thing is I’ll be gone for a few months and I don’t know how Sheldon’s gonna feel about that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, he’s a grown man, he can take care of himself.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You really believe that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Once again, you got me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How can you work on something for a year and they just take it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t believe the Air Force would treat us like that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I have a good mind to stop paying my taxes. It’s too bad I enjoy doing them so much. The Air Force did it again. They’re erasing our lives.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Third floor, wrong apartment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Although, if anyone’s gonna clean out your apartment and disappear, it’d be Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She might disappear, but she’s definitely not cleaning anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s okay, everything’s here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You won’t believe it, the military confiscated our project.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re kidding. Why would they do that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They wouldn’t say.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I feel so betrayed. You know, all my life I thought Uncle Sam was a friendly uncle who brought you presents. Turns out he’s the other kind.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Can we just talk about something else?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, what’s going on with you guys?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give us some good news.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy’s got some news.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, um, Raj is moving out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no. When?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You doing okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Want me to put on some Neil Diamond? That always makes you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Then you’ll get all sexed up and I’m not in the mood. I mean, an entire year wasted.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You might be forgetting another accomplishment of the past year.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah, yeah, we brought life into the world.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? That’s the importance you put on us having a baby?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m happy about it, but, I mean, it’s not like I did much. I mean, after the first three minutes it was pretty much all you.

utterance.speaker: Penny (on phone)
utterance.content: So, did you tell him about Princeton yet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I’m waiting till he’s in a good mood.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, you might not live that long.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe I shouldn’t go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, stop it, he’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess. And he’ll have you and Leonard right across the hall the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Got to go. Morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I apologize for exceeding my allotted bathroom time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you feeling okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not really. Apparently grief can make one less regular.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry to hear that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I sat and I sat, but to no avail.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, the more details, the more sorry. Well, maybe this’ll cheer you up. I made your favorite oatmeal, plain.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s the occasion?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No occasion, I just wanted to do something nice for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re so kind. You know, I don’t know how I ever got by without you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. That’s sweet, but you, you did just fine on your own.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I thought that, too, but I’ve come to realize, I am completely dependent on you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, you’re, you’re being silly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, to wake up every morning and know you’re there is a great comfort to me. Mmm, tasteless. How do you do it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, what you need to do is put this Air Force project behind you and just dive into something new.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, there is our quantum cognition experiment. You and I could spend more time on that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know, I mean, let’s say we succeed in proving that our consciousness creates reality. I mean, what will we have really accomplished? You know, a loaf of bread’s still three bucks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m confused. You’re always saying that you want to spend more time with me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That is true, I have said that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, a lot, it’s very annoying. Has something changed? Um, is there something that you’re not telling me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was offered a summer research fellowship at Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Princeton? A fine institution. The place where Albert Einstein taught. And where Leonard got his PhD, so it may have gone downhill.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s wonderful. Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t accepted it yet. I wanted to talk to you first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is there to talk about? You have to take it. It’s important.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So are you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, but I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are, are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I may have lost my guidance system and my girlfriend, but I still have a colon full of yesterday’s meals to keep me company. Although, thanks to your high fibre breakfast, I’m sure that’ll be leaving me, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Guys.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.content: You’re still gonna go, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. Sheldon’s so vulnerable right now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Look, if the roles were reversed, he’d be on the first train to New Jersey, or the second train if there were teenagers on the first one.

utterance.content: You have to go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know, but what if Sheldon…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A lot of lectures?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, so you know.

utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.content: I found it right next to these kisses.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s too late for me. Save yourself.

utterance.content: So, are you excited to have your own place again?

utterance.content: I know and I’m sorry.

utterance.content: Okay. Oh, and just to be clear, I’m not being intimate with you in order to keep you from going.

utterance.content: I wasn’t thinking that.

utterance.content: Hmm, yes. Yeah, perhaps I’ve been harder on them than they deserve.

utterance.speaker: Amy

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll love you no matter what.

utterance.content: Howard Hughes saved his urine in milk bottles.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’ll cross that bridge when we come to it.

utterance.content: And you’ll text me when you arrive at the airport?

utterance.content: I will.

utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.content: Now of course, my 9am is your noon, so let’s avoid the whole good morning, good afternoon minefield, and let’s just say hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy

utterance.speaker: Amy
